Posts.Content: Leolady it hadn’t even occurred to me how we were going to swap details  9 months later and the chemo fog shows no signs of dissipating  thanks for your advice . Much appreciated xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras size 40D available

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, I have 3 M &S post op bras if anybody would like them? I didn't have a mastectomy, I just found they were wonderfully comfortable during my WLE's and radiotherapy .  There's a black, a white and a nude in size 40D. All in used but good, clean condition, pet and smoke free home etc.  best wishes Gill
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras size 40D available

Posts.Content: Got your friends request thank you . I’ll medsage you later when my wee one is in bed xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Bras size 40D available

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen :-)  I don't have a dressing Jo. All i have is 2 small plaster type dressings which I've had on since I left hospital last Wednesday. I'm due to see the consultant tomorrow morning though so perhaps she'll change it then. I have one plaster over the cut for the SNB and one  plaster for the WLE / nipple removal. My breast is huge at the moment !! :-) Bigger than the unaffected one but i read somewhere that swelling can make that happen so I'm sure it will go down soon. I'm still fairly bruised at the moment but nothing too bad.   No I haven't had chemo so it's not that. I had to have a suspect lymph node removed from the breast as well (i thought you only got them under your arms but seemingly not) , so provided that comes back clear and provided they got good enough clearance, my surgeon has indicated that I should only have to do radiotherapy after this. Fingers crossed  I think you may be right about the nerves knitting back together as I'm definitely far less numb under the arm pits and the sides of the breast this past few days and the tiredness is probably just the cocodamol/anaesthetic after effects. Well that's what I've decided anyways lol  I think I was just worrying and wanted to compare how someone else of similar time/WLE was doing because I felt so okay after op that I hate to feel that I'm slipping backwards now. My little boy is 10 and quite severely disabled so I really need to see myself going forwards not backwards as he needs a lot of care.   Anyways, thank you for replying and i really hope you get a good result next week Gill xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery yesterday

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies , Yes I'm going back in on the 10th May for more clearance . They didn't take  enough from round the 2nd lump because they didn't think it was a cancer . The Surgeon also needs to "sweep up " those precancerous cells that were found in the clearance of my main lump . She says I have a 90% chance of clearing it all out this time and that's a chance my surgeon feels I should consider rather than mastectomy due to better recovery time , less reconstruction etc  she says the lymph nodes will get taken care of by the radiotherapy.    So ..... thats what I've decided to do . Another attempt at clearance with a 10% chance of still having to go back for mastectomy.  One of my deciding factors was my little boy and being able to care for him again faster this way . They said it shouldn't be a factor in my decision  but that's easy for lto say when theyre not fighting social services for respite care and asking friends To help care for a disabled epileptic child !     Anyways, today is a new day and I'm much more positive today . I've ordered pink  bandanas online because I love pink and I'm organising a stairlift for my little boy so that the respite ladies can get him up to bed on their own . Upwards and onwards ladies :-)  Thank you for all your kind replies. It really helps xxx Jo - I'm sending you positive thoughts and prayers for Wednesday . For every positive there's a negative so as my result was pants , I'm praying yours will be brilliant lol xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery yesterday

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies,  Problem solved! the Surgeon told me today that while she was removing 5 lymph nodes,  she gave me a local anaesthetic into the muscle under my arm to help with the pain.  That's why i was so pain free for the first few days and then as it wore off , it became more painful. Problem solved  and it's actually much better today ;-)  Now the bad news  :-(    What they thought was a suspect lymph node in the breast was actually another very small cancer. They also found pre cancerous cells in the clearance that they removed and 3 out of 5 of the lymph nodes that the removed had cancer.  What can i say? I was gutted! I had my lump biopsied 6 months ago and it came back negative so when It was biopsied again in March they reassured me that it was unlikely to be cancer....but it was. And then i had an MRI and it came back fine.....before being recalled after it was checked a second time. And then i had another sonagram to check the suspect lymph found in the MRI and i was reassured that they had no concerns about it. I had it checked again on surgery day and the consultant said that the more she looked at it , the more convinced she was that it was fine. And finally it was removed under surgery and bugger me, it wasn't a lymph node after all, it was a small cancer tumour. I keep being reassured and then getting kicked in the gut. It's so hard :-(  I really need to sleep on this and try and get my head round it because right now I just can't take it in  night night Gill xxx
Posts.Title: Surgery yesterday

Posts.Content: Aw I'm not having a tough time as such, I was just expecting to be looking after my son again this week and it's not happening. For a good job hubby is still off work 'because I'm still weak and tired which does not sit well with me because I'm normally a whirlwind :-)   My lump was 2 1/2 cm and just off to the side of the nipple so to gain clearance they had to take the nipple too. Surprisingly it's not the nipple area that's sore though, it's my underarm and SNB area . I'll talk this through with Fiona my BCN tomorrow though and see what she says. Yes they've told me my results will be back tomorrow. Keep everything crossed for me ;-) xx
Posts.Title: Surgery yesterday

Posts.Content: Hi Jo, Do you mind me asking you how you're feeling now? We both had our ops within a day of each other and your surgery sounds identical to mine -  radioactive injection, guided wire and lumpectomy. And same as you, i was out that same day and felt great for the next 2 days. After that though it's kinda been a bit downhill and I'm not sure if I'm being a right wimp. I stopped taking the cocodamol after day 1  because i felt it was making me very tired with shaky jelly legs. Instead i took the odd paracetamol for a day or so as i really wasn't in much pain. The last few days though it's all changing. I'm now 8 days post op and I'm sorer now than i was then, I'm taking paracetamol 4 hourly and I'm constantly tired with weak legs. I think the pain is worse because my underarm is losing a lot of its numbness and is sorer when i move it but I'm not quite sure why i'm still so tired though. I just really thought it would all be getting better by now :-(  Gill xx
Posts.Title: Surgery yesterday

Posts.Content: Thanks Shey. Beautiful picture. Don’t suppose we can change that ship for a cruise liner with cocktails and champagne though can we ? Lol xx

Posts.Content: Thanks Ann. I’m running behind now because I had my chemo suspended for 5 weeks and then I moved onto 12 weekly sessions of chemo instead with a few weekly breaks as well whenever I became too symptomatic.  I’ve finally made it though and I’m looking forward to getting these rads started and finished asap hope things are going well with you too xx

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies , mine starts 11th Dec .  Gill xx

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza,  I don't suppose you're in Scotland are you? I'd quite happily come to your appointment with you and then share a rather large glass of wine afterwards :-)  Gill xx
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza10, Ive been switched to weekly paxlitaxol also after complications with my 2nd dose of FEC. I had stomach pains and diarrhoea filled with blood. I'm having 12 weeks worth which is the equivalent of 4 three-weekly doses (1extra to make up for missing out the last FEC).  I also had a granny nap for 2 hours  yesterday afternoon and suddenly I've gone the other now and I've been awake most of the night it's such a pain   Hope it all goes well for you on the weekly  Gill xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi Nikki and Ann,  yes I had rectal bleeding after my 2nd cycle of FEC . I feel we are getting different advice here though. My chemo was instantly suspended for 5 weeks as I was at "an increased risk of infection " . my chemo nurse told me that they'd had a previous patient who hadn't told them that they were bleeding and the patient later died due to infection. Obviously I do not want to scaremonger here but I think it's important to find out which consultant is correct.  I had the threat of not being allowed to continue my chemo hanging over me but eventually She changed me to weekly chemo for 12 weeks with Paxlitaxel instead of  Docetaxol. I have to see her every week as well and report that I am fine with no diarrhoea and no bleeding  Gill xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: ha ha share away to your hearts content Nikki :-) It really does help just to get it out and know that people understand. What anti sickness meds did they give you? Gill xx
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: I had my 2nd FEC last wednesday 5th July and I have felt amazingly okay since then - till today :-) and now the mouth ulcers are back ! exceptionally tired , weakish jelly legs etc I'm just so surprised that it's all kicked in at this late stage. I really thought I was going to sail through this one lol Mind you, I'm still really not complaining as it's so so much more bearable than it was was last last time round. I'll just roll with it, take the tablets and sleep it out because I now it'll be better in a few more days. One thing i do want to ask though. I've a bit of pain in my shoulder blades/back this time and  I haven't yet had any of the bone injections so this is a new symptom for me . Does anybody else get this?  thanks Gill xxx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: You did start the week after me Anni but that's us in sync now because of my weeks delay. How you feeling so far? My first cycle was hideous so they reduced the dose. I'm hoping this one is better. I was a wee bit nauseous with a headache this morning but few pills popped and feeling much better now lol  gill x
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Well that's me dropping out of chemo club ladies . Unfortunately after my 2nd FEC I developed diarrhoea with blood in it . My consultant deems it is now too risky for me to continue with chemo and so I'll be starting radiotherapy sooner instead .  I am in all honesty gutted but the choice isn't mine.  I wish you all the best in the world ladies  Much love  Gill xxx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Mazza10 you are not a wimp and how can you say you're not suffering too if it's making you feel so crap. You need to be kind to yourself luvvy and I'm sure your family wouldn't think it a burden at all if you told them how you were feeling. Have you phoned your chemo nurses and told them how you feel? Mine keep drumming into me that I should not suffer in silence in any way. If I have a problem then they can usually find a cure so I'd give them a wee ring if I was you, explain how your feeling and hopefully they can give you something for the nausea, diarrhoea etc. Please don't feel alone. You've got all of us lot to chat to :-) My 2nd FEC is tomorrow. I had my first on 8th June but had to delay last weeks 2nd dose because of the mouth ulcers. I'm good to go tomorrow with a reduced dose though so fingers crossed. Big hugs to you and if you need to chat more, just shout Gill xxx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Edwina , I went to a look good , feel good workshop at my local Maggies and had one to one tuition on makeup . With no eyelashes the best thing for me was to ring my eyes with eyeliner, smudge it a little so it wasn’t too stark and then draw the eyebrows in with the Bobby Brown eyebrow palette. Very expensive but I used it every day and still use it now 6 months later to fill in the baldy patches I’ve been left with .    You could ask your chemo nurse but I believe you’re not meant to get brows tattooed until at least 6 months after chemo finished so I’m not sure that’s an option .     One of the most effective things I found was that I always wore a bit of fake tan during my chemo to make me look a healthier colour    Good luck on your phased return  Gill xx
Posts.Title: Eyebrows and eyelashes - What do you do when they are gone??
